title: How to Take Apart Your Nintendo DS and Safely Put It Back Together

steps.headline: Remove a two rubber tabs on the back side of Nintendo DS, and open the battery cover using the Quatro-wing screwdriver.
Remove all those screws using the Quatro-wing screwdriver and Tri-wing screwdriver.
Remove a battery and unscrew a two screws, which are beneath the battery.
Locate and unscrew a two screws.
Carefully remove the circuit board and there you have it your touch screen and entire lower board.
steps.description: Simply follow through these stages carefully backwards to create a fully working DS again.

text: Remove a two rubber tabs on the back side of Nintendo DS, and open the battery cover using the Quatro-wing screwdriver.  Remove all those screws using the Quatro-wing screwdriver and Tri-wing screwdriver.  Remove a battery and unscrew a two screws, which are beneath the battery.  Remove back faceplate carefully.  Locate and unscrew a two screws. Remove black and white wire. Carefully remove the circuit board and there you have it your touch screen and entire lower board. Simply follow through these stages carefully backwards to create a fully working DS again.
sentences: Remove a two rubber tabs on the back side of Nintendo DS, and open the battery cover using the Quatro-wing screwdriver.
Remove all those screws using the Quatro-wing screwdriver and Tri-wing screwdriver.
Remove a battery and unscrew a two screws, which are beneath the battery.
Locate and unscrew a two screws.
Carefully remove the circuit board and there you have it your touch screen and entire lower board.
Simply follow through these stages carefully backwards to create a fully working DS again.
